intro: Pediomelum brachypus, commonly known as the short-stemmed pediomelum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces achenes as its seed type. Pediomelum brachypus is often found in fynbos vegetation, where it contributes to the region's biodiversity.
